author: Greg Bensinger
title: Uber Feared It Fell Behind in Driverless-Car Technology, Kalanick Testifies
text:
SAN FRANCISCO—Former Uber Technologies Inc. chief Travis Kalanick testified Tuesday the ride-hailing company grew concerned in 2015 it was falling behind on developing self-driving vehicles seen as critical to its future, prompting it to go into business with a star Google engineer.

That decision opened up Uber to a blockbuster lawsuit from Alphabet Inc.’s Waymo now under way in federal court over allegedly stolen autonomous-car trade secrets. Waymo executives had grown increasingly concerned about Uber poaching more executives...
